name: Soufiane Boutaib
review: Horrible . So I was in Cafe like 10 min walk to bus stop . And bc it so cold I decide to use this app to keep tracking time on 65 bus . First it was showing 20 min to come then after 5 or 7 min I check again it says 35 mins I was like oh ok strange . Then after 5 min I check again the 65 bus not on the list anymore . I run to bus stop and it seem this app played me up . Problem there is not even bus next hour . Next one is 2 hours after . In this cold night and horrible waiting after work :(

name: Susan Ann O'Brien
review: Very different and frustrating with the 75bus route , as I use that service all the time, and for example , I was waiting on my bus early morning time and it was due when I got to the bus due in 5mins and that bus never came I had sit there & wait for another half hour sometimes it's , longer , I use this bus to go to deangrange , Stillorgan St John's of God's Where I have a mother whom has very serious health problems 10wks she's there now , before she was in Michael's hospital Dunlaoghaire. ðŸ˜“

name: Terrahawk78
review: Your app only works 70% of the time. Seems to have trouble around busy times which is obviously when it's needed. Also, random quiet times. Don't try to make excuses as I've had several friends try their phones at 21:30 at night... same results. Also, not sure if it's you or Dublin bus but sometimes it counts down minutes to arrival on a bus which never appears. Basically these things considered, your app is pointless and need not exist. App deserves -8

name: Paul McMahon
review: The update brings a nicer interface, but maps still dont work properly. When on a bus stop and click show on map, the app just closes. When looking at a route map under timetable, Am seeing the page cant load google maps correctly, and map then only shows in small section of screen.

name: Max Brennan
review: If you want to figure out in what general millennia your bus is coming in, congrats, you found your app. But if you want to know if it is coming in the next 10 minutes, good luck. Oh so many a time have I checked the app for it to tell me the next bus is in 30 minutes, then just as I'm about to reach my stop a minute later, the bus flies past me and my stop.

review: Could really benefit from street view support.

review: Who is in charge of setting the bus times and routes??? Absolutely dreadful planning!!! I get the 123 bus home after work and sometimes I need to wait 25mins for a bus because 2 (sometimes even 3!) come at the same time and I miss them!!! Why do more than 1 of the same buses start their journeys at the same time?!?!?! The app itself is fine. Just the planning on behalf of Dublin Bus is woeful. Sort it out!

review: The quality of the real time traffic data is poor that it's essentially useless on many routes. There has been no perceptible improvement to it in years. Error handling is poor at times, especially when buses cannot be retrieved at all, and the UI could do with a facelift. The interfaces problems could be overlooked if the data within was accurate.

Either your buses are completely detached from reality or your app is.

review: Middling at best. Could be so much better.  Too much reliance on stop numbers for simple queries. These are of very limited usefulness, especially for visitors.  Also, searches often come to an inexplicable dead end, with the app seeking your direction of travel, but giving you only a blank screen below the request and no means of progressing.  Maybe somebody in Dublin Bus could iron out the wrinkles in this app?  It has a lot of unrealised potential.

The text is too small and the overall experience is very cluttered and confusing. Some pages don't allow zooming and the text is tiny. Too much information presented to the user who may be looking for something simple. Needs better organisation/UI/UX.

review: Absolutely Useless app. Watching buses counting down from xx min till 0 and then disappearing without passing its on daily basic. Thanks for wasting my time ðŸ‘Ž

name: Gabor Sipkoi
review: What's the reason befor all the mystery with Dublin bus routes? I can't find any app or website where I can point to two places in the map and it returns the bus routes connecting them. This App is an example: it allows you to search by bus stop number, but there are situations when you don't know the bus stop number and would prefer to simply point on the map. It's true the app has an option to search by address by that ends up returning a list of bus stop numbers which is useless most of the times.  It's definitely not an easy and straightforward app to use.  Another thing Iâ€™d like to point: there are at least two bus routes from the airport to the city centre (747 and 41). But for any combination Iâ€™ve tried, this app only gives you the most expensive option (route 747).

Very old in everything and probably just converted from the iOS one to

review: Most unreliable app in the whole world.. this app can get you sacked .. you better off walking than using this.

name: Lee G
review: This app has used 3.6gb of data in the last 3 days. Seriously what's going on here? I have screen shots to submit if you need them Devs.

name: Hugh Pearse
review: There are a number of problems with this application. (1.) When performing a search by stop number or by route, the entire real time data set is downloaded to the phone which is very slow. Why is a search query not sent first from the phone to the server and respond with a smaller amount of data? (2.) When viewing a bus stop the app displays a list of routes which can not be clicked. Why not allow the user to open it and display a list of more stops for that route? (3.) Why can only stops be added to favorites and not routes?.  (4.) Why can alerts not be set for individual routes passing a stop? When it is raining especially, nobody wants to stand outside in the rain, but they also don't want to miss a bus that only passes twice a day. (5.) Why are the static timetables not displayed as well as the real time information? When the real time server is down for unscheduled maintenance then the app is completely useless.   Overall this app demonstrates a lack of software design, planning which is demonstrated by a lack of basic usability. Made by people who never took a bus in their life. Where did the developers get the non functional requirements? It works, but not well.

name: Dizi dee
review:
Loved this app when it used to work but now it just hangs 60% of the time 
and the map function no longer works. Pity.

name: Ian Grahame
review: About reliable as their bus service

name: NAD S
review: Tells exactly when the bus will come

name: Brian Scully
review: The app works mostly and when it does it's immensely useful. But sometimes my bus disappears from the upcoming busses for a given stop for no reason. Also, and not related to the app specifically but more about the busses themselves, generally my bus, the 33, is too infrequent. Please feed this back to whoever is in charge please. Keep up the work on the app. Maybe combine it with with the leap card app.

name: Katiuscia Ranieri Iannone
review: Working again, 5* because fixed very quickly

name: J Healy
review: App no longer works crashes on launch after update today 10th June 2016

name: Katarzyna Kasia
review: Not working after todays update!!! How am I suppose to know when is bus if app doesn't even want to open! Thanks Dublin Bus

name: Conor Hayes
review: Hasn't  been in any way accurate any time I've used it. Can anyone explain how they estimate the bus time. I use a bus that's frequent enough. God help someone that's relying on these timetables for a bus that's not so frequent. Use this app for finding routes, busstops but don't rely on being anywhere on time

name: Padraic McElroy
review: This would be a good app if the "real time" information was reliable.  I've lost count of the number of times I've been waiting at the stop and the bus due time goes down to 2 or 3 minutes, only for the bus to disappear from the timetable. My stop is one of the first on the route so due times should be easy to predict.

name: Dave Davis
review: *Same review 2 years later*. 2 years and I see the review section full of the same complaints. Ghost busses. Seriously guys. It's been ongoing for years. Since version 1. Why do you refuse to acknowledge this? Sort it out. If I wanted to know when a bus was due and then not due, I'd ask my coffee. If I want to stand and wait for a bus that's not going to arrive, I'll wait at a DART station. Another app where CLEARLY neither management nor developers actually use it.

name: darren hedley
review: Good app to compliment the fantasy that is the Dublin Bus timetable. What people have to remember is that it gives the estimated time of arrival from a fixed point along the route it doesn't take into account hold ups such as traffic or passenger delays, it may stay at 10 minutes for half and hour because of this. Niggles. On android once you close it, it opens again. Could do with a press and drag for arranging the favourite bus stops. Lastly folders to organise stops on a particular route/journey.

name: Etce Tera
review: Good though can never get wifi in bus! I register register register and register but it doesn't work. Used to have a BlackBerry and had no probs using Dublin Bus Wifi. I commute everyday wih Dublin Bus and train and i never have any issue using wifi in train, unlike in bus!

name: Eoghan Agar
review: Probably the worst app I have ever come across...half the time it doesn't worked. Majority of the time I check it it's unavailable or apparently no bus routes exist...usually have to reset the app a few times before I can check a bus time. Probably quicker walking down to the bus stop and checking it there

name: Moira Reilly
review: When it works it's great, but you cannot depend on it. Frequently will not show stop information, often when it worked fine minutes before, resulting in guess work and waiting ages outside for buses. Also, if you close it and go to open another app, like Facebook, Dublin Bus will pop up again!

name: TomÃ¡Å¡ PolÃ¡k
review: Could be so much better, if it tried to go beyond the website functionality.  The most annoying is that it always reads the full list of bus stops and full list of routes from the internet, which is with 2G connection really a pain. Come on - why you don't save it locally and compare just some kind of hash value and redownload on change only. Can't be that hard to implement.

name: Dave Murphy
review: As a whole, can't fault the app. Dies what it says on the tin but the 'Real Time Information' section is a disgrace. Frequently buses just drop-off and disappear while '2mins' all top often becomes '10mins' which begs the question , how is your 'real time' data actually calculated? 30 minutes today waiting for a bus that was supposedly 5 minutes away!!

name: Shane O Brien
review: The app is great,  it's a contender for my most frequently used app. Remember the old days,  when you used to have to stand in the cold,  blindly waiting for a bus like a chump? No more! Well,  except for those times when the app predicts a bus in 5 minutes and you step outside,  trusting smile on your face,  only to discover upon reloading the stop information that the bus in question never existed and you now have to wait around in the cold for 15 minutes. Like a chump. But they're rare enough.

name: Marc Laffan
review: Apart from having buses disappear from the app, this is really good. Please do something else instead of just taking the bus out of the queue. If it's definitely being rerouted, then let us know! More than once has a rerouted bus found its way back on route, but not shown up on the app. This inconsistency is really annoying and wastes a lot of time. Just put "rerouted" next to the rerouted bus and you'll have a lot more happy commuters.

name: Paul Archbold
review: When I use the app to see where my bus for work in the morning is I'm usually told 20 mins so I leave my house to go to bus stop 10mins away and said bus will be either just pulling up or pulling away. 9/10 times this happens and I'm then left waiting for an additional 30 minutes for the next. Also I feel like the app should be fitted with a notification that there is already a wheelchair user on board or full to capicity with baby prams.

name: A Google user
review: Has been two minutes behind the "real time" displays at bus stops for a few days. Why? Why bother to ask? Dublin Bus won't reply. I use the app so I don't have to run for the bus but there's no point using it now.

name: brenda kelly
review: I take back my previous one star for no timetable. I found where it was in the top left corner, something that should have been shown, now I can use it more often with more ease.

name: Joseph Ephtamandilos
review: Many a time I've missed a bus even though I aim to get there at least 5-8 mins before real time information. If that doesn't work it defeats the whole purpose of the app. Not good enough sloppy service

name: Ethan Hamman
review: It actually worked fine until I uninstalled and reinstalled it yesterday (admittedly for no real reason), but now it just crashes every single time I try to open it. It just says "loading" for about a second and then closes. (When it actually did work, it would probably have been 3 or 4 out of 5 stars)

name: Ceire Hoey
review: Its a good app if you know the bus routes, otherwise there's a lot of working it out yourself. There should be an option to put in where you want to go from your location, and the app should work out what bus (or numerous buses) will get you there, including maps. Like most other journey planners.

name: Elaine O Hara
review: Have had this app about 18 months and find the 'Real Time'  largely reliable. The service wasn't operating over Christmas & New Year though, don't understand why? Definitelty worth having though.

name: Mercy Kings
review: Writing this report as Dublin bus are always depanding this dat and not caring about students, workers and those unable to drive to their destination no buses available in some part of Dublin & d strike for depands is ridiculous government creating buses available in all parts of Dublin some part have bus stage but no buses going to that part especially lucan, clontaf to croke park so many others the bus sometimes stops where u have to walk back again to get another bus cant wait to win lotto and

name: Carl Nolan
review: Gets the job done but it's just clunky and crap. Has felt outdated from day 1

name: IrishWolfHound
review: Missed another coach home in town because of you guys

name: david saunders
review: Rubbish app.can't even see the writing on where the bus stops are.get a grip.I thought we had great tec people in Ireland.pay that bit more and make it simple

name: Adam Letmon
review: Sometimes I arrive at the bus stop and I just miss the bus even though the app says it shouldn't be there for another 30mins.... Frustrating....

name: Kenneth J. O'Riordan
review: Takes away some of the pain of having to travel by Dublin Bus. Has been wrong about real time data a couple of times but otherwise works as implied.

name: Francisco Passos
review: Workable, but not user friendly. Also the stop screens don't exactly day the same as this and those seem more accurate.

name: Amy Foley
review: If I have to keep uninstalling it then installing it again just to get a time for a bus I'll end up uninstalling it and not bother installing it again! So annoying I can't get a time for a bus.

review: A really helpful and handy app,  I moved out of the city for the first time and this has softened the blue for being used to public transport!

review: Brilliant. Never been let down on times.Never thought I would live to see the day. The

name: Robert Dempsey
review: Good app. Better if could log in with your Google account and save your "starred" bus number

name: Aldrin
review: Pretty good app. Just need to know the bus stops number

name: Shane McKenna
review: It's good but you should have it available on Windows phone.

name: Claire Kenneally
review: Would b more if calculate ur fare would work

name: Darren Rayner
review: No more waiting needlessly in the cold:)

name: Leo Nally
review: Does what it says on the tin

name: John Duggan
review: Decent app that gets the job done most of the time. I have a complaint though. The app seems to have a habit of not listing busses. I got to the 27 stop on the Greenhills Road at about 12.40pm and I was told the next bus wasn't coming until 1.23pm. I waited until about 12.55pm before walking on. Less than five minutes later, a 27 drove by me. Very frustrating.

name: Dean O'Rourke
review: 'Sorry, No real time information is available for this bus stop' - How bad is this like. Why not put in when the next bus is due to leave that goes past that stop or something useful. Far too many times I'm getting this message. And why can't the android app be as fluid and nice looking as the IOS version?

name: Amanda Fagan
review: This is the second time I have to write to Yous , honestly Yous need to get a better IT team on this.. and once again your going to make me late for work.. I am so annoyed !!!!

name: Sean Conway
review: Does the job but does it too slowly. Is it difficult to take a bus off the real time information knowing that it isn't even on the road? Because that is the biggest problem I have with the service

name: Davy Ryan
review: "Sorry no realtime information available" Why do I have exit that page and find the stop again? Why is there no button to refresh that page? Would be handy to be able to rename favourites too

name: Kiev
review: The app has the wrong times half of the time, information is down a lot not a very good service, if fixed will rate more!

name: Konny G
review: Would be a great app if it worked!very frustrating,standing at a bus stop right now with full 4g coverage yet it refuses to load!

name: Sam B
review: The route planner is okay, but it can't take an address as your start or end point - you need to already know where the stops are. The route info does not show a fare price, you have to memorise the beginning and end stop numbers, the route number, and the route endpoint and then enter them manually to get a fee listing. A lot of extra work that should be done by the app.

name: Richard Nealon
review: Didn't work at all on android

name: Graeme Fox
review: Excellent app..saved me from waiting in freezing cold many mornings:)

name: Tiffany Lee
review: Helpful but would be handier if you can use it without needing internet!

name: Vishnu Suresh
review: Works. But a bit complex to navigate

name: Sabrina Hanney
review: Brill app. Iv a huawei ascend y530 n no problemz wih dis app. Highly recommended... seriously :-)

name: Cillian Keohane
review: Even though its an iOS port it does quite well

name: Peter Duffy
review: An app for those living in Dublin

name: Brian Phoenix
review: Would be nice to have a last bus reminder

name: Barry Walsh
review: Real time updates work very well

name: Graham O'Brien
review: Why can't I give it zero stars? Pile of crap. Doesn't recognise streets or bus route numbers. I'd be better off walking down the road blindfolded and getting into the first vehicle that stopped. Useless.

name: David Mullan
review: Not as goid as the other app which as been out for ages

name: Ximo PL
review: It is useful to get I info about the next buses if you are in a stop without real-time panel.   This app it is devoted to real-time info. It's difficult to know the exact routes of the buses. For a map of Dublin with the routes you must go to the webpage. Furthermore, nothing seems to be cached and internet connection is required. From time to time there's an outage and not even the nearest stop info works.

name: Alier Ajuong
review: Great idea almost pulled it off.  I wonder what's the story with these ghost buses floating around? Many times a bus will be approaching your stop, you can even track its arrival time from the previous stops  only for it to completely disappesr off the list? Off the top of my head 11 has disappeared before reaching #3023 and 46a before 847

name: Sarah B
review: When it works, it's pretty good.  HOWEVER it very regularly stops working and you get the "Realtime information not available for this stop" message for every stop you try, or upcoming buses regularly disappear and occasionally reappear 20 minutes later, and of couse there are stops where the route has changed and the bus no longer passes them, but the app still predicts that the old bus is coming.  That's a lot of fun on a rainy day.

name: Christopher Dalton
review: This app caused me to think a bus was coming when it was not. The location of the stops are wrong. I ended up having to get a taxi that I could not afford., leaving me and my very young family getting home at all hours last night. I'm so annoyed with this app. Epic fail....... Continued....now buses that are hourly only are appearing and then disappearing, I get ready to go, cancel, then the bus appears....this app gets worse.

name: Michael Setbon
review: This app hasnt been thought through

name: Stephen Phillips
review: This app is a very good concept and well designed. It's big failing however it is loading in the data for the bus stops and routes every time you use it which makes it very unreliable at times, especially on a 3g connection. If it had all the data loaded into the app it would be a LOT faster and would be the best bus app of all time. Would be 5 stars if not for the reliability issue.

name: A Google user
review: It will be very hard for you to find the correct bus. This app is useful when you know the route number and want to find its stops, timing, etc. If you don't, it's a trial and error clicking a map until you find an appropriate route. It should have an option to tell the app: I'm going to this point, and then it tells you the possible routes based on your location.

name: Kevin Nolan
review: Pretty pointless when buses just disappear and you're stuck waiting for the next one. I can just wait and not waste my time looking at this useless app. At least Google maps now has actual route information rather than a bunch of dropped pins like this app. I'm typing this while waiting for yet another no show bus...

name: Pablo Carranza
review: Good functionally but too data dependent

name: Fearghal Donnelly
review: A token effort for an appalling service.

name: A Google user
review: Could be a whole lot better,says it's passed one stop but yet 3 mins until it's at the next one and not a bus to be seen passing by? Simple logic.

name: A Google user
review: Amateur software. Timings are different with website and overall not user friendly and buggy.

name: kivalily
review: Useless doesnt work at all on my alcatel

name: Jo seph
review: Doesn't always tell you the next bus

name: Joanne Harris
review: Great app. I use it all the time

name: Eric Bannon
review: Updates are always welcome but it's so annoying when the existing app isn't updated in place of just releasing a completely new one. What about all the stops already added to favourites? Also, the devs should know you leave out "app" (not to mention the version number) in the name of the app. The News section is still as buggy as ever - wrong encodings and pictures missing.

name: Ginta Grinberga
review: If I don't have to be anywhere on time it's good to know estimated times. However, if I'm in a hurry I wouldn't trust this so called 'real time info' because it's almost always couple of minutes wrong... Not to talk about the times when the bus dissappears from realtime even though there's still a few minutes until it will be at your stop...

name: Vlad Belov
review: I just wanted to check if the busses are operating as usual on Dec 23rd and the 25th (in case if you guys stop running them for Xmas holidays)..Checked every single bit and corner of the app back-to-back but couldn't find any info on that. I think it's important to have a little note somewhere or something - otherwise, how can I plan my trips?

name: Ellis Amdur
review: This app is a waste of time, it says 18 minute for bus 40 then changes to 25 minute after 30minute of waiting 3 bus 40 shows up what a mess. Completely waste of time. A nanny was looking at me checking the bus app she said I shouldn't waste my time checking the technology that the bus is coming soon wow what a hope, even when I know am already late going to work I still have to smile and I said technology are shite

name: Jesse Nijder
review:
You need to know the bus routes before you can use the app. So if you don't 
know the stops close to your destination you have no use for this

name: Take a chill Phil
review: Decent but here's a tip... Reminders. It would be very useful if I could set a notification reminder if my highlighted bus is due in 8 minutes for example, giving me plenty of time to leave the house & arrive at my bus stop without the worry of missing the bus.

name: Andrew McDonnell
review: Regularly the real time is inaccurate and can have you waiting excessive amounts of time even at off peak time where there is no traffic to account for.

name: Michal MasÃ¡r
review:
Busses still coming late or not at all. Missing option for feedback in the 
app. Make your services better for better rating. Thanks.
